replication_study.hypothesis: Among strong democracies (democ >= 9), higher political polarization—as operationalized by the standard deviation of responses to the government responsibility question (sd_gov)—is associated with lower government consumption (gov_consumption).

data_plan.dataset_identifier: replication_data/data.csv (country-level cross-section, circa 2010; waves 5–7 present in column 'wave')
data_plan.source_type: Compiled cross-national dataset (aggregated WVS polarization metrics with macroeconomic and institutional controls from sources consistent with the original study).
data_plan.wave_or_subset: Strong democracies: Polity IV democ >= 9; WVS waves observed in data range from 5 to 7 (min=5, max=7 in 'wave' column).
data_plan.sample_size: 31 countries (full dataset); final N for the model may be slightly lower after listwise deletion.
data_plan.unit_of_analysis: Country (cross-national aggregate, one row per country; year=2010 for all observations).
data_plan.access_details: Provided locally under replication_data/data.csv; at runtime, place/copy as /app/data/data.csv.

qualification.explanation: This dataset includes country-level polarization (sd_gov), government consumption, and the core controls used in the original study’s long specification, enabling a within-construct replication of the focal negative association in strong democracies.
qualification.similarity_to_original: The original study constructs polarization from WVS economic policy questions and relates it to government size with controls (post_registration.json; original_paper.pdf summary). The provided dataset includes sd_gov (a WVS-based dispersion measure), gov_consumption, Polity IV democracy measure (democ), and key controls such as log_gdp_per_capita, trade_share, federal, oecd, region and colonial dummies, and demographics (replication_data/data.csv columns). These align with the original study’s core variables and control strategy (post_registration.json method and results; original_paper.pdf summary).
qualification.deviation_from_original: The initial_details.txt highlights a focal coefficient for the 'Private' polarization measure (-18.73 in the long specification), whereas our dataset exposes sd_gov (GOV question) but not sd_private. Therefore, we replicate the core relationship using the GOV polarization metric instead of the PRIVATE metric. Additionally, the original includes ~83 countries across multiple waves and additional variables, while this dataset contains 31 countries, predominantly for year=2010 with waves 5–7 (post_registration.json vs. replication_data/data.csv). The paper also reports a GOV-based long-spec coefficient around -19.56 in strong democracies (original_paper.pdf summary), which better matches our operationalization.

data_plan.notes: Some controls have limited missingness (e.g., several colonization/region dummies and trade components have 30 non-null out of 31); listwise deletion will be applied. All IO is required under /app/data. The dataset is a country-level cross-section (year=2010), which limits panel-based strategies; wave is used only for dummies as available.

planned_method.steps: 1) Place replication_data/data.csv into /app/data/data.csv. 2) Run the Python script replication_data/run_replication.py. 3) The script subsets to strong democracies (democ >= 9) and fits OLS with HC1 robust SEs of gov_consumption on sd_gov with controls (log_gdp_per_capita, trade_share, demographics, federal, oecd, regional and colonial dummies, and wave dummies if present). 4) Save outputs to /app/data: replication_results.json, replication_results.csv, and replication_summary.txt. 5) Compare sign, magnitude, and significance to original benchmarks.
planned_method.models: Cross-sectional OLS with heteroskedasticity-robust (HC1) standard errors.
planned_method.independent_variables: Primary: sd_gov (standard deviation of responses to the government responsibility question).
planned_method.control_variables: log_gdp_per_capita, trade_share, age_15_64, age_65_plus, federal, oecd, africa, laam, asiae, col_uka, col_espa, col_otha, and wave fixed effects (dummies) if available.

planned_estimation_and_test.estimation: Coefficient on sd_gov in OLS with HC1 robust SEs (long-spec style controls as available).
planned_estimation_and_test.test: t-test for H0: beta_sd_gov = 0 (two-sided), with sign expected negative.

planned_method.inference_criteria: Primary: negative sign and p < 0.05 for sd_gov; secondarily compare magnitude to original long-spec benchmarks (Private ≈ -18.73; GOV ≈ -19.56).

files.replication_data/run_replication.py: Entry-point script. Reads /app/data/data.csv; subsets democ >= 9; regresses gov_consumption on sd_gov with HC1 robust SEs and controls (log_gdp_per_capita, trade_share, demographics, institutional, region/colonial, wave dummies if available); writes results to /app/data/replication_results.json, /app/data/replication_results.csv, and /app/data/replication_summary.txt.

codebase.notes: Ensure /app/data/data.csv exists at runtime (e.g., mount ./data:/app/data). The script depends on numpy, pandas, statsmodels (which requires scipy).

analysis.instructions: 1) Place the provided CSV at ./data/data.csv so it mounts as /app/data/data.csv in the container. 2) Run: python replication_data/run_replication.py. 3) Inspect outputs in /app/data: replication_results.json (machine-readable), replication_results.csv (tabular), replication_summary.txt (human-readable + full regression summary).
analysis.comparison_metrics: Compare sign (expect negative), statistical significance (p < 0.05), and magnitude of the sd_gov coefficient to original long-spec results. Given the data uses sd_gov (not sd_private), the closest reported benchmark is GOV long-spec around -19.56 (original_paper.pdf summary); initial_details.txt cites -18.73 for the PRIVATE measure as an additional reference. Report differences in magnitude and note deviations due to measurement (GOV vs PRIVATE) and sample size.
